snippet.title: Sydney chef Jason Wright puts avocado on toast on the dessert menu
snippet.content:
Avocado Toast Dessert 0:54
Arthur's Oysters and Seafood in Manly makes Smashed Avocado on Toast- as a dessert
August 3rd 2017 18 hours ago
Avocado on smashed toast at Arthur's Oysters & Seafood. (AAP image Julian Andrews).
Beverley HudecManly Daily
Share
SMASHED avo on toast for dessert? Innovative chef Jason Wright will flip breakfast at his new Manly restaurant, Arthur's Oysters & Seafood. The wacky dish is one of the desserts the former Scottish Rising Star Chef of the Year has created. "Smashed avo on toast is so popular in Manly, I wanted to have some fun with food and do something that hasn't been done before," he said. "It is essentially breakfast as a dessert. Everyone who has tasted it is loving it."
Avocado on smashed toast at Arthur's Oysters & Seafood. (AAP image Julian Andrews).Source:News Limited Mr Wright's take on the hipster favourite is made by mixing pureed avocado with Glace vanilla bean ice cream. Wright, who started as a pastry chef, makes 'toast' from toasted dessicated coconut, white chocolate and panko breadcrumbs. This dish is plated up with dollops of mango puree and his piece de resistance, corn flake sauce. Customers won't need to dip into their savings, smashed avo on toast is $14. Arthur's Oysters & Seafood is located at 46 Pittwater Rd. It opens on August 8. Originally published as
